abstract: Bear Stearns‘s former chairman and chief executive, Alan C. Greenberg, is planning to give $360,000 to some of the firm’s lowest-paid workers, who may lose their jobs when Bear merges with JPMorgan Chase, The New York Times reported.
lead_paragraph: Bear Stearns‘s former chairman and chief executive, Alan C. Greenberg, is planning to give $360,000 to some of the firm’s lowest-paid workers, who may lose their jobs when Bear merges with JPMorgan Chase, The New York Times reported.

headline.main: A Gift to Bear’s Mailroom, From the Boardroom

abstract: Mars‘s $23 billion deal to buy candy maker Wm. Wrigley Jr. Company is the second-largest merger announced so far this year, and that means some tasty fees for JPMorgan Chase and Goldman Sachs if the deal goes through.
lead_paragraph: Mars‘s $23 billion deal to buy candy maker Wm. Wrigley Jr. Company is the second-largest merger announced so far this year, and that means some tasty fees for JPMorgan Chase and Goldman Sachs if the deal goes through.

headline.main: Sweet Day for Candy Deal Advisers
